Title: Junior Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
Your mission

As a Junior Data Scientist during our 6 month internship, you‚Äôll be an active member of our data science team, responsible for designing, building, and deploying components of our data and machine learning stack. The position will be on-site in our Berlin office. Example projects include:


Designing and maintaining ETL pipelines to process supplier and customer data from Excel, PDF, ERP, and unstructured sources.
Building data wrangling, cleaning, and validation pipelines to ensure high-quality, reliable datasets for downstream models.
Contributing to recommendation systems based on live inventory, purchase behavior, and customer preferences.
Using Prefect, Airflow and MLflow to manage workflows, track experiments, and deploy models.
Evaluating model performance and proposing improvements.
Supporting the creation of dashboards and KPIs to monitor algorithm performance and business impact.
Collaborating with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to align technical solutions with real customer needs.


Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is junior but job-ready - able to contribute independently while still growing their skills. You should have:


~1 year of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or data engineering (internship, research, or industry).
Strong skills in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with SQL and working with structured data.
Knowledge of ETL pipeline design and data wrangling.
Familiarity with MLOps tools such as Airflow or MLflow.
Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals (training, validation, evaluation, deployment).
An advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another quantitative discipline.
The ability to communicate clearly, explain your approach, and work well with both technical and non-technical team members.


NICE TO HAVE


Experience with graph databases (e.g., Neo4j) and writing Cypher queries.
Exposure to large language models (LLMs) and their ecosystem (prompt engineering, RAG, CrewAI, Agno, LangChain, or LangGraph).
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deploying models on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).


Why us?


Ownership of projects with a focus on outcomes rather than time-tracking
Fast-paced yet collaborative culture fostering individual performance and teamwork
Competitive compensation based on experience
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
Subsidized Deutschlandticket
Hybrid work format
Beautiful office located in the heart of Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin
Regular team building events, company breakfasts and Friday drinks


About Us

We are a Berlin-based start-up that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

We are a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up.

Title: Data Analyst / Experience Analytics - Digital Workplace (w/m/d)
Description:
Du hast eine Leidenschaft f√ºr neue Technologien und m√∂chtest zu einer nachhaltigen, gr√ºneren Zukunft beitragen?

Dann werde zum Playmaker und verst√§rke unser Team als Data Analyst / Experience Analytics - Digital Workplace (w/m/d) bei der E.ON Digital Technology.

Wir entwickeln kreative Ideen, gehen neue Wege, lassen Visionen Wirklichkeit werden und erwecken innovative Technologien zum Leben. Unser Ziel ist die Entwicklung und Bereitstellung nachhaltiger Technologiel√∂sungen, denn‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ it‚Äòs on us to make new energy work!

Das Team ‚Äì dein Beitrag

Das Experience Command Center (ECC) ist eine zentrale Einheit innerhalb der Domain Global Technology Platforms / Digital Workplace. Unsere Mission ist es, durch Problem- und Eskalationsmanagement sowie Data Insights den Produktteams ein effizientes Arbeiten zu erm√∂glichen. Wir zeigen Verbesserungspotentiale innerhalb der Produkte auf, sodass Innovationen schneller umgesetzt werden k√∂nnen und stellen sicher, dass unsere Nutzer die bestm√∂gliche IT-Erfahrung erhalten.

Deine Rolle ‚Äì sinnhaft & wertvoll


Du erstellst datenbasierte Trends und Reports zur Unterst√ºtzung und Verbesserung unserer Digital Workplace Produkte
Zu deinen Aufgaben geh√∂rt ebenfalls die Administration und Optimierung von Client-Systemen mithilfe von Skriptsprachen wie PowerShell, Batch und SQL
Mit Hilfe von APIs verkn√ºpfst du Device-Managementsysteme und sorgst f√ºr eine reibungslose Integration und Datenaustausch
Du dokumentierst komplexe technische Vorg√§nge und Probleme
Komplexe Daten, Business-Themen und deren Zusammenh√§nge analysierst, verstehst und visualisierst du f√ºr fundierte Entscheidungen
Du arbeitest eng mit Dienstleistern zusammen, formulierst Anforderungen und l√∂st Herausforderungen
Gemeinsam mit Product Ownern und Experten aus verschiedenen Fachbereichen bist du Teil eines internationalen, cross-funktionalen Teams



Dein Profil ‚Äìauthentisch & neugierig


Eine IT-Berufsausbildung oder ein Bachelorstudium in einem technischen Bereich (z. B. Fachinformatik, Daten-/Prozessanalyse, Data Science) bildet die Grundlage f√ºr diese Position
Vorzugsweise hast du bereits Berufserfahrung im IT-Support gesammelt, wodurch du ein fundiertes Verst√§ndnis √ºber die Funktionsweise von Clients, Software und deren Administration im Unternehmenskontext mitbringst
Gute analytische F√§higkeiten sowie Berufserfahrung in der Analyse von Daten im Bereich End User Computing sind vorhanden

Title: Product Analyst - (Logistics Customer, Seamless)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the ‚Äúdata-first‚Äù mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

Qualifications


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Platform
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Staff Product Analyst to join our Tools & Workflow vertical in the Platform product team and help us scale and improve our products across 50+ countries!

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 200 million customers in 50+ countries. We‚Äôre a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission ‚Äì to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

Platform team operates across all Bolt verticals, supporting business growth and success. The team tackles problems including geospatial (routing, ETAs etc), user identity and verification, user communications, internal tools, automation, customer support and internal experimentation.

As a Staff Product Analyst at Bolt, you are much more than a data cruncher. You are co-leading the development of the product and will drive the product strategy with other analysts in Tools & Workflow. The teams in this area own the complete support experience for Bolt users and build tools and technology for efficient workforce management. You will be at the forefront of evaluating how Automation and Artificial intelligence can bring value to the support experience and lead discovery to find product opportunities with an optimum balance between cost-effective and quality support.

Your daily adventures will include:


Driving data mindset in the team, mentoring team members and being a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Holding accountability for measuring product success for the whole space, designing relevant and actionable metrics and owning A/B testing best practices to make better and faster product decisions
Closely collaborating with your partners in Product Management, Engineering, Data Science, and other functions to drive forward cross-functional product and analytics initiatives and ensure seamless execution
Development of the in-depth analytical understanding of what drives the growth of products and leadership over the discovery of new opportunities to inform and steer the product strategy



About you:


You hold a university degree in Economics, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management or similar studies
You have 5+ years of experience working in Product Analytics and/or Data Science
You rank your SQL skills as ‚Äúoutstanding‚Äù & Python/R skills as ‚Äúprofound‚Äù, and you have experience with BI tools and data visualisation
You have strong business acumen, an entrepreneurial mindset and possess outstanding communication and leadership skills, with the ability to decompose complex solutions and insights into a clear narrative
You have an advanced understanding of end-to-end A/B testing, including some knowledge of concepts such as time-based testing or other causal inference methods
You have experience in designing, building, and managing complex data models and handling large unstructured and semi-structured data



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don‚Äôt tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you‚Äôre the kind of person described above!

Why you‚Äôll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/x) Product Analytics
Description:
Job Description

We at sevDesk:

We at sevDesk don't have a universal formula for happiness in the world of work either, but we work together every day to understand exactly what can permanently increase our sevFamily's sense of happiness. One thing is for sure: with us, you can be exactly who you are and work in a way that suits you and your needs! It's not the work that defines us, it's us that define the work!

Our culture is not artificial, it is real. Be yourself at sevDesk - BE YOURSEV!

Your mission:

You are an analytical consultant for the data- and insights-driven development of our product portfolio. With your analyses, you identify growth potential and influence our product roadmap with your recommendations for action.

Here's how you'll make an impact:


You drive analytics initiatives that inform product strategy, user growth, and engagement optimization, ensuring alignment between data outputs and business priorities.
You translate data into clear, impactful insights for product and marketing teams to guide feature development and customer experience improvements.
You‚ÄØdevelop actionable insights through powerful visualizations, cohort analysis, etc. supporting experimentation, lifecycle management, and personalization efforts.
You lead and own the implementation of data collection and product experimentation, establishing rigorous methodologies and clear metrics frameworks.
You mentor peer analysts and stakeholders in best practices for data interpretation, dashboarding, and storytelling, driving a data-first product culture.


Your Qualification:


You have at least 5 years of experience in the digital environment. You have already worked as a Data Analyst (m/f/x) for at least 3 years and have mentored other analysts.
You have a degree in (business) informatics, economics, (business) mathematics,‚ÄØcomputer science, or comparable.
You have at least 2 years of application experience in SQL and a good technical understanding of common data modelling techniques such as Kimball‚Äôs Dimensional Modelling and/or OBT.
You have experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Power BI, Tableau) and analytics tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Amplitude, Google Analytics).
You have relevant experience in the conception and evaluation of A/B tests, a functional knowledge of statistical testing‚ÄØtechniques is a plus.


Our Techstack: SQL | Snowflake | dbt | Python | Looker | Metabase | Mixpanel

Job Requirements

Your sevdesk Experience

Drive Impact: Make meaningful contributions and help move initiatives forward across teams. Your input will be valued, and your work will have a direct influence on sevdesk's success.

Empowered Ownership: take charge of your work and projects with the expectation of making decisions independently, supported by a team that's there when you need guidance.

Competitive Compensation: Includes a stock option plan and company pension to reward your contributions.

Time to Recharge: 30 vacation days, 3 additional days for social engagement, plus 30 Workation days to work from anywhere in the EU.

Flexible Work Environment: We believe in working where you‚Äôre most productive, whether that‚Äôs at home or in the office. Our hybrid approach balances flexibility with in-person collaboration, fostering trust and strong teamwork when we come together.

Comprehensive Benefits: learning budget, bike leasing, monthly voucher of choice (Amazon, IKEA, Car Sharing, ‚Ä¶), Amazon book flat, corporate discounts and more.

Team Vibes: Enjoy regular team offsites and quarterly events packed with networking and fun!

For more insights, visit us on Instagram



Contact:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Marc Riehle
Show more

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering tech professions such as software engineering, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities.*

Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the tech industry. We are successfully producing highly desirable tech professionals in the most competitive EdTech market in the world - the US market.

What you will do:


Conduct exploratory analyses to uncover actionable product insights and opportunities from our existing data
Independently lead full-cycle analytical projects ‚Äî from scoping problems from stakeholders requirements to initiating data collection (if needed) with data engineers and developers, and delivering actionable outcomes:
Tableau dashboards
In-depth product research reports
Evaluation of changes from the experiment (without A/B testing)
Foster a data-driven culture by training and advising product teams on data-informed decisions, experiments set up, designing metrics (product, learning, KPIs)


Requirements:


3+ years experience in the role of data/product analyst.
Ability to choose an appropriate statistical test and conduct statistical research
Experience independently analyzing data and generating hypotheses/insights using industry-standard analytics tools (i.e. SQL, Python)
Strong data communication and interpretation skills including designing dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Upper-intermediate (B2+) English level.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience doing analytics on educational products
Experience with PySpark and/or Tableau


What we can offer you:


Fully remote and full-time collaboration with professional freedom and minimal micromanagement;
Dynamic Team: Join a diverse, global team with experience across tech, ed-tech, and various industries;
We use digital tools like Miro, Notion, and Google Workspace for seamless collaboration;
Impactful Work: Your efforts directly influence the success rates of students finding jobs post-graduation.
At this time, we are unable to offer H-1B, L-1A/B sponsorship opportunities.
This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.


Ôªø


TripleTen is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, protected military/veteran status, or any other legally protected factor.

Eine strukturierte und eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise zeichnet Dich ebenso aus wie Teamf√§higkeit, analytisches Denken sowie Erfahrung in der datenbasierten Recherche und Informationsaufbereitung

Title: Junior Database Engineer Intern
Description:
Company Overview

Join our team as a Junior Database Engineer Intern and gain hands-on experience with modern database design, PostgreSQL administration, and enterprise data synchronization. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to learn professional database management while working on a real-world recruitment platform integration.

Position Summary

As a Junior Database Engineer Intern, you will assist in maintaining and improving our Manatal database synchronization system. You'll work closely with senior engineers to learn best practices in database design, performance optimization, and professional documentation.

Learning Opportunities & Responsibilities


Assist in monitoring database performance and creating performance reports
Learn PostgreSQL database administration and optimization techniques
Help document database schemas and relationships using professional ERD tools
Support data validation and quality assurance processes
Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
Learn Docker basics and container management
Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
Participate in database design reviews and team meetings



Required Basic Skills


Educational Background:
Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses

Technical Foundation:
Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
Comfortable with command-line interfaces
Strong analytical mindset

Soft Skills:
Excellent attention to detail
Strong problem-solving abilities
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and in a team
Eagerness to learn new technologies



Good to Have Skills


Previous internship or project experience with databases
Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
Experience with any ERD or database design tools
Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
Understanding of JSON data format
Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
GitHub experience for version control
Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
Basic understanding of API concepts



What You'll Learn


Enterprise-level database design and optimization
Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
Modern database platforms and cloud services
Docker and containerization for databases
Real-world data synchronization challenges
Professional development practices



Internship Details


Duration: 6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
Remote work available
Mentorship from senior database engineers
Hands-on experience with production systems
Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Show more

  • Support data validation and quality assurance processes
  • Participate in troubleshooting data inconsistencies
  • Assist in writing SQL queries for reporting and analysis
  • Learn Docker basics and container management
  • Contribute to technical documentation and data dictionaries
  • Explore modern database platforms like Supabase
  • Participate in database design reviews and team meetings


Required Basic Skills

  • Educational Background:
    • Currently pursuing or recently completed degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field
    • Strong academic performance in database or data structures courses
  • Technical Foundation:
    • Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL basics
    • Familiarity with at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, or similar)
    • Basic understanding of data structures and algorithms
    • Comfortable with command-line interfaces
    • Strong analytical mindset
  • Soft Skills:
    • Excellent attention to detail
    • Strong problem-solving abilities
    • Good written and verbal communication skills
    • Ability to work independently and in a team
    • Eagerness to learn new technologies


Good to Have Skills

  • Previous internship or project experience with databases
  • Familiarity with PostgreSQL or other SQL databases
  • Experience with any ERD or database design tools
  • Basic knowledge of Docker or containerization
  • Understanding of JSON data format
  • Exposure to Linux/Unix environments
  • GitHub experience for version control
  • Familiarity with modern database platforms (Supabase, PlanetScale, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of API concepts


What You'll Learn

  • Enterprise-level database design and optimization
  • Professional ERD tools and documentation standards
  • PostgreSQL advanced features and performance tuning
  • Modern database platforms and cloud services
  • Docker and containerization for databases
  • Real-world data synchronization challenges
  • Professional development practices


Internship Details

  • Duration: 6 months (with possibility of extension or full-time conversion)
  • Flexible hours (minimum 20 hours/week)
  • Remote work available
  • Mentorship from senior database engineers
  • Hands-on experience with production systems
  • Certificate of completion and recommendation letter for successful interns

Title: Senior Product Analyst - (Quick Commerce)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Senior Product Analyst to join our Data Analytics team within Quick Commerce, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of redefining how customers experience quick commerce. You‚Äôll help build technology that scales our non-food offerings, reaching new market segments and driving revenue growth. By innovating within our Quick Commerce Team, you‚Äôll make Delivery Hero the go-to platform for a broad range of products, helping us grow faster and deliver more value to customers around the world.

You will partner closely with Product Managers, driving operational excellence and strategic insights across Fulfillment Operations, Supply Chain and Demand Planning. Focusing on metrics monitoring, deep dive analysis, experimentation, and fostering a data-driven culture. Your insights will directly shape product roadmaps, optimize features, and assess impact. You will define KPIs, design experiments, and communicate findings to senior stakeholders. You'll help us ensure product initiatives deliver measurable business value, transitioning from a reporting mindset to a problem-solving approach. Your work will directly impact our ability to scale and grow our non-food offerings.

Key Responsibilities:


Collaborate with Product Managers and cross-functional teams to define hypotheses, KPIs, and success criteria
Conduct in-depth analyses of product usage, adoption, and impact metrics to identify trends and opportunities
Design and execute experiments(A/B, Quasi-experiment) to optimize product features and user experience
Establish effective causal inference strategies to evaluate interrelations and identify growth drivers
Support the implementation of tracking strategies and ensure data integrity
Generate business intelligence solutions and compelling visualizations to communicate key insights


Qualifications


Proven 3-5 years experience in Product Analytics or Data Analytics, ideally within a fast-paced product-driven environment
Excellent stakeholder management, communication and collaboration skills
Strong technical expertise in analytics stack including SQL, dbt, Airflow, and Python, with proficiency in visualization tools (Tableau, Looker Studio) and experience with A/B testing platforms (Optimizely, Adobe Target)
Solid understanding of statistical concepts, experimental design, A/B testing methodologies and Quasi Experimentation
Experience with event tracking and instrumentation tools
Ability to work autonomously and navigate through uncertainty


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team?

If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate, and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Description:
Solandeo liefert Daten und Intelligenz f√ºr die Energiewende: unsere Kunden nutzen Gr√ºnstrom effizienter, setzen ihre Batteriespeicher optimal ein und minimieren ihren Energieverbrauch. Damit machen wir es m√∂glich, Angebot und Nachfrage von Gr√ºnstrom zu vereinen. So bringen wir die Energiewende voran, gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden und mit namhaften Partnern.

Wir sind ein zukunftsorientiertes Unternehmen mit einem motiviertem Team, erfolgreichen Produkten und ambitionierten Zielen. Mit unseren St√§rken in IT und effizienten Prozessen ver√§ndern wir die Energiebranche.

Sie schafft Transparenz, f√∂rdert datenbasierte Entscheidungen und verbindet operative Exzellenz mit strategischer Weitsicht. Deine Aufgaben Im Detail


Du entwickelst, gestaltest und pflegst interaktive Dashboards und Reports mit Microsoft Power BI sowie weiteren BI-Tools.

Du arbeitest eng mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern zusammen und √ºbersetzt Business-Anforderungen in smarte Datenl√∂sungen.

Du hast einen Studienabschluss in einem relevanten Bereich, z. B. Mathematik, Statistik, (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet.

Du bist fit in Microsoft Power BI (DAX, Power Query, Datenmodellierung) und kennst Dich idealerweise auch mit weiteren BI-/Visualisierungstools (z. B. Tableau) sowie Python aus.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber solides SQL-Wissen und hast Erfahrung im Umgang mit Data Warehouses.
Du verstehst Datenarchitekturen, ETL-Prozesse und die Prinzipien von Data Governance.
Du kommunizierst klar und √ºberzeugend - sowohl auf Deutsch als auch auf Englisch - und kannst Insights verst√§ndlich auf den Punkt bringen.
Du bist detailorientiert, proaktiv und beh√§ltst auch in einem dynamischen Umfeld mehrere Themen im Blick.
In der interdisziplin√§ren Zusammenarbeit zeigst Du Teamgeist, Offenheit und die F√§higkeit, gemeinsam tragf√§hige L√∂sungen zu entwickeln.


Wir sind uns bewusst, dass kaum ein Profil alle Anforderungen vollst√§ndig abdecken kann. Wenn Du bereit bist, Dich fachlich weiterzuentwickeln und bereits erste einschl√§gige Erfahrungen mitbringst, bist Du bei uns ebenso richtig!


Unsere Flexibilit√§t bei Arbeitszeit und Arbeitsort gibt Dir den Freiraum, Deine beruflichen Ziele zu erreichen, ohne auf pers√∂nliche Zeit verzichten zu m√ºssen.
Unsere offene und wertsch√§tzende Unternehmenskultur sorgt daf√ºr, dass Du Dich vom ersten Tag an wohlf√ºhlst und gerne zur Arbeit kommst.
Menschlichkeit & Anerkennung sind unsere Treiber. Bei uns werden Deine Beitr√§ge gesehen, damit Du in einem respektvollen Umfeld kontinuierlich wachsen kannst.
Wir leben Diversit√§t, denn vielf√§ltige Blickwinkel beschleunigen die L√∂sungsfindung.
Freue Dich auf gemeinsame Events, bei denen wir Erfolge feiern und den Teamgeist st√§rken.
Entdecke die Welt und bleibe produktiv! Mit unserer Workation-M√∂glichkeit kannst Du neue Kulturen kennenlernen und gleichzeitig an spannenden Projekten arbeiten.
Deine Karriereentwicklung liegt uns am Herzen! Wir setzen auf eine individuelle F√∂rderung Deiner Kompetenzen, die auf Deine beruflichen Ziele und W√ºnsche abgestimmt sind.
An Deinem Geburtstag √ºberraschen wir Dich mit einem Geschenk, das unsere gemeinsame Mission f√ºr Nachhaltigkeit und Umweltschutz widerspiegelt.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics | Assisted relocation to Barcelona
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:




The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are specifically looking for an analyst to act as a trusted thought partner to marketing stakeholders with a focus on overhauling data infrastructure, driving measurable outcomes, optimizing our brand content strategy, and scaling cross-sell programs across our many customer engagement channels. They will have experience operating autonomously to deliver on complex, cross-functional initiatives.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.

Your Responsibilities:

Build the lifecycle data infrastructure from the ground up ‚Äì defining our measurement strategy (A/B tests, rotating holdouts, etc.), building conversion-based datasets for near-real-time customer interactions, and facilitating an expansion into push notifications and paid reactivation campaigns
Partner with our global brand team to optimize our brand content across multiple channels, including email, blog, and organic channels.
Own the cross-sell analytical functions for our email and blog programs, growing the reach of our brand voice to new target audiences.
Influence the global strategy of your partner teams by crafting and refining key performance indicators that measure the health of our business




Your Qualifications:

At least 4 years experience working cross-functionally with complex datasets to support organizational decision making.
Fluency in SQL. You would feel confident reviewing code produced by other analysts and data scientists, as well as assisting non-technical colleagues with their reports in an office hours setting.
Hands-on experience running A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
Familiarity with programming in Python or R.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate models and results to business partners in a useful, concise, and meaningful way.
Experience working with cross-functional business partners to define business problems, scope project deliverables/timelines, implement reporting solutions, and frame organizational strategy.
You prioritize your work on impact to the business and can gracefully push back on stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Two-sided marketplace and/or marketing analytics experience
Understanding of digital touchpoints and measurement mechanisms
Marketing analytics with a focus on customer lifecycle marketing
Meaningful experience processing large data sets at scale. This could include languages like Python or R, as well as frameworks like Spark, Hive, or dbt.
Experience with AWS (Redshift, S3, EMR)
Understanding of modeling techniques, such as linear regressions, causal impact models, and bootstrapping. You know the trade-offs of each of these models and can propose the right model for the test at hand




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Locations:

This position is located at our Barcelona office
We assist with relocation to Barcelona




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.

Your Responsibilities:

  • Build the lifecycle data infrastructure from the ground up ‚Äì defining our measurement strategy (A/B tests, rotating holdouts, etc.), building conversion-based datasets for near-real-time customer interactions, and facilitating an expansion into push notifications and paid reactivation campaigns
  • Partner with our global brand team to optimize our brand content across multiple channels, including email, blog, and organic channels.
  • Own the cross-sell analytical functions for our email and blog programs, growing the reach of our brand voice to new target audiences.
  • Influence the global strategy of your partner teams by crafting and refining key performance indicators that measure the health of our business


Your Qualifications:

  • At least 4 years experience working cross-functionally with complex datasets to support organizational decision making.
  • Fluency in SQL. You would feel confident reviewing code produced by other analysts and data scientists, as well as assisting non-technical colleagues with their reports in an office hours setting.
  • Hands-on experience running A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis
  • Familiarity with programming in Python or R.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate models and results to business partners in a useful, concise, and meaningful way.
  • Experience working with cross-functional business partners to define business problems, scope project deliverables/timelines, implement reporting solutions, and frame organizational strategy.
  • You prioritize your work on impact to the business and can gracefully push back on stakeholders


Nice to Have:

  • Two-sided marketplace and/or marketing analytics experience
  • Understanding of digital touchpoints and measurement mechanisms
  • Marketing analytics with a focus on customer lifecycle marketing
  • Meaningful experience processing large data sets at scale. This could include languages like Python or R, as well as frameworks like Spark, Hive, or dbt.
  • Experience with AWS (Redshift, S3, EMR)
  • Understanding of modeling techniques, such as linear regressions, causal impact models, and bootstrapping. You know the trade-offs of each of these models and can propose the right model for the test at hand


Benefits of working at Rover:

  • Competitive compensation
  • Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
  • Permanent contract
  • Pension plan
  • Meal tickets through Cobee
  • Generous PTO allowance
  • Private health insurance
  • Discounted gym membership
  • Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
  • Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
  • A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
  • Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more


Locations:

  • This position is located at our Barcelona office
  • We assist with relocation to Barcelona


Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Senior Product Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
The role

We are seeking a driven and ambitious Data Analyst to join our growing Data Analytics team, based in Berlin. Our team provides support across all teams like Product, Sales and Operations by developing insights and enabling analytical and automated decision making. We build strong partnerships with key stakeholders and work on challenges such as defining, implementing and tracking company-wide metrics, and leading initiatives to improve them.




Zenjob is on the mission to become the digital staffing platform delivering companies best staffing experience with the highest flexibility and reliability, and workers the best choice and fair pay for side jobs. Our service is available in over 39 cities in Germany. Our growth financing round of $50 million (‚Ç¨45 million) from February 2022 is helping us to scale our platform and add new data-based automation features for our rapidly growing customer base.




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Requirements gathering

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and define data analytical requirements that will help driving business initiatives
Define KPIs, success and health metrics in the context of product and business initiatives

Data collection and preparation:

Identify relevant data sources and work with data engineers and tracking experts to source the right data into the analytics environment
Prepare data to make it suitable for the analysis in context

Data exploration and analysis:

Conduct exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights
Utilize statistical methods to extract actionable information from data
Develop and maintain core data models to support business analysts

Experimentation

Support stakeholders during the hypothesis formulation and validation phase
With the collaboration of the data science and engineering teams, design and implement experiments around upcoming product features

Visualization and reporting

Design and create effective data visualizations to communicate insights and trends
Hands-on experience with traditional BI tools (Tableau, Metabase) and, ideally, product analytics tools (Indicative) as well

Communication and collaboration

Communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and nontechnical audiences
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, data engineers, and product managers and decision makers
Provide training and support to end users for interpreting and using data visualizations in a self-service manner effectively




What you‚Äôll bring

5-+ years of relevant experience interpreting data as an analyst or equivalent
High proficiency in querying and modeling data using Python and SQL
Ability to translate a business question into an analytical requirement considering its context: what the business is trying to achieve, the processes around it, the systems that interact and the data points available
Analyze the results of A/B-test experiments and derive conclusions or new hypothesis the business can follow up on
Great communication skills in stakeholder management from diverse backgrounds
Great communication skills in storytelling capable of creating a consistent narrative that gives meaning to the numbers
Extensive experience using different data visualization and reporting tools
Experience on analytics engineering using dbt is highly desirable
Plus: experience with experimentation platforms (eg. ABSmartly, Optimizely) and product analytical tools (eg. Indicative, Amplitude)




What we offer:

A supportive, open, and fun team that will have your back from day 1.
Twenty-eight days of vacation (increases based on tenure to up to 30 days), 1-day special leave paid for charity work, five days of paid educational leave, and the option of unpaid leave.
Hybrid work setup combining office & remote work (3 days from office, 2 days home), flexible working hours, bring your dog policy.
Ongoing focus on your personal development (annual development budget of EUR 750, mentoring opportunities, continuous career conversations)
Mental Health support via Likeminded
Monthly 30 EUR subsidy on Urban Sports Club, 25% discount on FitX gym membership
Monthly 40 EUR credit for NAVIT- a sustainable mobility solution spanning public transport bike-sharing.
Tax-free meal allowance (saving EUR ~50 net per month!)
Quarterly team get togethers, budget for employees birthdays, winter & summer parties plus regular cultural talks & events




If this sounds exciting to you, then we'd love to find out more about you! Apply and send in your application.




Life at Zenjob revolves around innovation, collaboration, and growth. Check out our video for a glimpse into what it's like to be part of our team: Link to Video üé•

We invite you to explore our Career Page, follow our LinkedIn page, and connect with us on Instagram.




We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to assessing every qualified person according to their skills, regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status or religion. It is not necessary to include your photo and age with your application.

Title: Product Analyst, Fixed Term, Maternity Cover - (Logistics, Customer)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Product Analyst - (Logistics, Customer) to join the Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences. This is a fixed term role (maternity cover)

In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-10 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalogue for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs


Qualifications


4+ years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for Internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject, (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL and Python skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Experience with data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus) and version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects; proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes. Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Nice to have: Experience with Airflow, experience with A/B testings and applied statistics and experience with using data lakes/data marts


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Company: For Life Produktions- und Vertriebsgesellschaft f√ºr Heil- und Hilfsmittel mbH
Description:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.




Your Tasks:

Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives




Your Profile:

2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus




Our Benefits:

Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.

HTML:
We are FORLIFE! We are passionate about developing, manufacturing, and distributing stoma, incontinence, and wound care products, as well as supportive products for enteral nutrition. Our ambitious goals have helped us become one of the leading suppliers of medical devices in Europe. At our modern production site in Berlin-Adlershof, over 150 employees work to identify and meet the needs of patients and healthcare professionals.


Your Tasks:

  • Direct to Consumer(DtC) project support: Contribute to the development and execution of our DtC initiative ‚Äî including setup, insights on consumer behavior, and performance tracking
  • CRM data cleansing & consistency: Ensure high-quality customer and device data by identifying and resolving duplicates or gaps in our CRM system
  • Customer segmentation & analysis: Deliver targeted segmentation and behavioral insights to support commercial, marketing, and clinical strategy
  • Master data quality assurance: Maintain and improve product and customer master data across internal systems, hospitals, and patient portals
  • Dashboard & report creation: Build intuitive dashboards (Power BI, Excel) to support decision-making with relevant KPIs, trends, and user metrics
  • Process improvement: Collaborate with Sales, R&D, and Support to optimize CRM workflows and ensure data governance and compliance
  • Go-to data resource: Serve as the central contact point for business stakeholders who need analysis, reporting, and structured data support
  • Support strategic and clinical initiatives: Provide data and insights for product launches, service evaluations, compliance reporting, and patient-focused initiatives


Your Profile:

  • 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analytics or business intelligence, ideally in healthcare, pharma, or another regulated industry
  • Proven ability to manage projects and drive deliverables independently across multiple functions
  • Strong stakeholder management skills ‚Äî able to collaborate with commercial, clinical, technical, and leadership teams
  • Hands-on experience with CRM systems (e.g. Salesforce, SAP, Dynamics, or similar)
  • Strong skills in Power BI, Excel, SQL, and Python
  • Experience or interest in DtC analytics, customer behavior, or e-commerce tracking
  • Interest in AI tools such as Microsoft Fabric ‚Äî Microsoft‚Äôs unified platform for analytics and BI
  • Strong analytical mindset and confident communicator
  • Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, or related field
  • Being Fluent in English is a must, German a plus


Our Benefits:

  • Meaningful work ‚Äì Your work contributes to the reliable manufacture and use of vital medical devices.
  • Great team: A motivated and helpful environment that supports you.
  • Company pension plan with a 20% employer contribution for a secure future.
  • Special payments in accordance with the company agreement.
  • Individual training opportunities to promote your professional and personal development.
  • Business bike leasing for environmentally friendly and healthy mobility
  • Regular team events to promote strong and collegial cooperation
  • Mobility or sports subsidy: Choice of subsidy for BVG ticket or Urban Sports Club

Vollst√§ndig ausgerollte, benutzerfreundliche Self-Service-Dashboards mit >90 % Adoption in allen GTM-Teams in Superset

W√∂chentliche + monatliche Executive-Briefings mit klaren Handlungsempfehlungen zu Umsatz- und Effizienzpotenzialen
Time-to-Insight <50 % gg√º. Vorjahr

Radikale Ehrlichkeit bei gleichzeitig wertsch√§tzender Kommunikation

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Intern)
Description:
Your mission

As a Junior Data Scientist during our 6 month internship, you‚Äôll be an active member of our data science team, responsible for designing, building, and deploying components of our data and machine learning stack. The position will be on-site in our Berlin office. Example projects include:


Designing and maintaining ETL pipelines to process supplier and customer data from Excel, PDF, ERP, and unstructured sources.
Building data wrangling, cleaning, and validation pipelines to ensure high-quality, reliable datasets for downstream models.
Contributing to recommendation systems based on live inventory, purchase behavior, and customer preferences.
Using Prefect, Airflow and MLflow to manage workflows, track experiments, and deploy models.
Evaluating model performance and proposing improvements.
Supporting the creation of dashboards and KPIs to monitor algorithm performance and business impact.
Collaborating with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders to align technical solutions with real customer needs.


Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is junior but job-ready - able to contribute independently while still growing their skills. You should have:


~1 year of practical experience in data science, machine learning, or data engineering (internship, research, or industry).
Strong skills in Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, etc.).
Experience with SQL and working with structured data.
Knowledge of ETL pipeline design and data wrangling.
Familiarity with MLOps tools such as Airflow or MLflow.
Solid understanding of machine learning fundamentals (training, validation, evaluation, deployment).
An advanced degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another quantitative discipline.
The ability to communicate clearly, explain your approach, and work well with both technical and non-technical team members.


NICE TO HAVE


Experience with graph databases (e.g., Neo4j) and writing Cypher queries.
Exposure to large language models (LLMs) and their ecosystem (prompt engineering, RAG, CrewAI, Agno, LangChain, or LangGraph).
Hands-on experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with deploying models on cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).


Why us?


Ownership of projects with a focus on outcomes rather than time-tracking
Fast-paced yet collaborative culture fostering individual performance and teamwork
Competitive compensation based on experience
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
Subsidized Deutschlandticket
Hybrid work format
Beautiful office located in the heart of Prenzlauer Berg, Berlin
Regular team building events, company breakfasts and Friday drinks


About Us

We are a Berlin-based start-up that has successfully established a leading B2B marketplace for industrial metals across Europe.

The multi-billion-euro metal trading industry is operated on Excel, PDF and Email. We are on a mission to transform buying and selling in one of the oldest industries of the modern world with seamless and intuitive digital solutions. Our technologies increase liquidity, accelerate transactions, reduce scrapping rates and enhance buying convenience for hundreds of steel and metal distributors across Europe.

We are a lean team of young, international, and passionate talents gearing up for the next phase of growth. We are looking for an outstanding individual who wants to join an exciting early stage start-up.

Title: Werkstudent Data (m/w/d)
Description:
Intro

Die CKM Group b√ºndelt Expertise aus verschiedenen Bereichen, um Fortschritt und Innovation in der Gesundheitsversorgung voranzutreiben. Unser Zusammenschluss aus Klinik, Labor, telemedizinischem Service und IT-Unternehmen steht f√ºr die Entwicklung moderner und effektiver L√∂sungen im Gesundheitswesen.

Unser Ziel ist es, durch pr√§ventive Dienstleistungsmedizin, eHealth und Public Health eine f√ºhrende und wegweisende Rolle im Gesundheitssystem von morgen einzunehmen. Dabei setzen wir auf smarte Logistik, Digitalisierung, Diagnostik und individuelle Pr√§vention. Wir denkenGesundheitsversorgung und Diagnostik neu und hinterfragen dazu stets den Status Quo.

Ein neuer Pfeiler dieser Vision ist GreenMedical: Mit unserem telemedizinischen Service bieten wir einen einfachen und sicheren Zugang zu medizinischem Cannabis, um Symptome zu lindern und die Lebensqualit√§t zu verbessern. K√ºnftig wollen wir unser Angebot um L√∂sungen zur Gewichtsreduktion und Rauchentw√∂hnung erweitern, um noch mehr Menschen individuell zu unterst√ºtzen und die Lebensqualit√§t zu verbessern.

Du liebst es, aus Daten Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und m√∂chtest mit deinen Analysen echten Mehrwert schaffen? Dann werde unser‚ÄØWerkstudent Data (m/w/d)‚ÄØund unterst√ºtze uns beim Aufbau intelligenter Datenprozesse und datengetriebener Entscheidungen!

Deine Mission bei uns


Datenaufbereitung & Datenbankmanagement:‚ÄØDu unterst√ºtzt beim Aufbau, der Pflege und Weiterentwicklung interner Datenbanken und sorgst gemeinsam mit der IT f√ºr strukturierte, konsistente Datenfl√ºsse.
Analyse & Visualisierung von Daten:‚ÄØDu f√ºhrst Auswertungen technischer und operativer Daten durch, entwickelst KPIs und √ºbersetzt Daten in verst√§ndliche Visualisierungen zur Ableitung konkreter Handlungsfelder.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering tech professions such as software engineering, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities.*

Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the tech industry. We are successfully producing highly desirable tech professionals in the most competitive EdTech market in the world - the US market.

What you will do:


Conduct exploratory analyses to uncover actionable product insights and opportunities from our existing data
Independently lead full-cycle analytical projects ‚Äî from scoping problems from stakeholders requirements to initiating data collection (if needed) with data engineers and developers, and delivering actionable outcomes:
Tableau dashboards
In-depth product research reports
Evaluation of changes from the experiment (without A/B testing)
Foster a data-driven culture by training and advising product teams on data-informed decisions, experiments set up, designing metrics (product, learning, KPIs)


Requirements:


3+ years experience in the role of data/product analyst.
Ability to choose an appropriate statistical test and conduct statistical research
Experience independently analyzing data and generating hypotheses/insights using industry-standard analytics tools (i.e. SQL, Python)
Strong data communication and interpretation skills including designing dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and presenting complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Upper-intermediate (B2+) English level.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience doing analytics on educational products
Experience with PySpark and/or Tableau


What we can offer you:


Fully remote and full-time collaboration with professional freedom and minimal micromanagement;
Dynamic Team: Join a diverse, global team with experience across tech, ed-tech, and various industries;
We use digital tools like Miro, Notion, and Google Workspace for seamless collaboration;
Impactful Work: Your efforts directly influence the success rates of students finding jobs post-graduation.
At this time, we are unable to offer H-1B, L-1A/B sponsorship opportunities.
This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.


Ôªø


TripleTen is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, protected military/veteran status, or any other legally protected factor.

F√ºr unseren Kunden Tagesspiegel sind wir auf der Suche nach einem Data Analyst.

ERP-Entwicklung: Du erstellst Reports, Stationeries und Angebotstemplates in unserem ERP-System Adpoint und entwickelst diese kontinuierlich weiter.
Projektmanagement: Du verantwortest die technische Umsetzung von Projekten - von der Anforderungsaufnahme √ºber die Konzeption bis zur Implementierung und Abstimmung mit Stakeholder:innen.
Fehleranalyse und Qualit√§tssicherung: Du testest neue Entwicklungen sorgf√§ltig, analysierst Fehler und sorgst f√ºr einen stabilen Betrieb.
Dokumentation: Du dokumentierst Schnittstellen, Workflows und Entwicklungen klar und nachvollziehbar f√ºr dein Team und f√ºr sp√§tere Weiterentwicklungen.




Das bringst Du mit:




Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python zur Entwicklung von Schnittstellen und Workflow-Automatisierungen.
Fundierte Erfahrung mit C#, insbesondere f√ºr die Erstellung und Pflege von Reports und Templates in ERP-Systemen
Sicherer Umgang mit SQL zur Datenverarbeitung und -analyse.
Erfahrung im Arbeiten mit AWS Cloud Services oder die Bereitschaft, sich hier z√ºgig einzuarbeiten.
Vertrauter Umgang mit GIT f√ºr Versionskontrolle und JIRA f√ºr agiles Projektmanagement.
Eigenst√§ndige, strukturierte und l√∂sungsorientierte Arbeitsweise.
Freude an der Arbeit in einem kleinen, fokussierten Team und an der Weiterentwicklung effizienter Tech- und Datenl√∂sungen.
Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mind. B2)




Das bietet dir Tagesspiegel:




Kreativer Freiraum in einem Team, in dem Ideen gesch√§tzt werden und Du Deine Visionen in einem innovativen Medienunternehmen im Herzen Berlins umsetzen kannst
Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation
Bezuschusstes BVG-Firmenticket und Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Kostenloses Digital-Abonnement von Tagesspiegel & Tagesspiegel Plus, Handelsblatt und die Zeit
M√∂glichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung durch die Online-Plattform Masterplan, um Deine Karriere voranzutreiben
Eine 38,5-Stunden-Woche mit 30 Tagen Urlaub (bei einer Vollzeitstelle), damit Du ausreichend Zeit hast, um Dich zu erholen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 50%




Jede Nachricht erz√§hlt eine eigene Geschichte - und so ist es auch mit den Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten. Beim Tagesspiegel sch√§tzen wir die Vielfalt unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter und sind fest davon √ºberzeugt, dass unterschiedliche Perspektiven unsere Arbeit bereichern.




Wir setzen uns f√ºr Chancengleichheit ein und f√∂rdern einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Unabh√§ngig von Herkunft, Geschlecht, Religion, Alter oder sexueller Identit√§t - bei uns bist Du willkommen. Lass uns gemeinsam ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, in dem jeder seine Einzigartigkeit einbringen kann!

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Data Engineer (f/m/x) - Berlin

EMBRACE THE WORLD: HOP ON YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE WITH US!

We are a lively and diverse team, founded by our CEO Julian Weselek in 2016, currently active in the DACH region and France. Our ambition is to become the leading travel company for authentic, customized, multi-day trips while being mindful of our planet: we are the first travel company in the EU to set near-term carbon reduction targets approved by the Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi): this is an imperative step toward decarbonization. We are and always will be driving the change in the travel industry for a better tomorrow.

DESTINATION? THE WORLD!

We are discoverers. We are believers in the life-changing power of travel. On our journey we've built the amazing team that we have today - a team that sets the ambition to be remembered for building the future of travel, for consistently changing the norms of the industry and, simply, for staying true to our passion for bringing together the cultures of the world.

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in enhancing the quality and effectiveness of our data landscape and the positive impact data has on Tourlane and our customers.

WHAT IS THE ROLE ABOUT?


Closely collaborating with data analysts, analytics engineers and other consumers of Tourlane data to maintain and incrementally improve our hosted data services
Improving and extending our existing data ELT processes, focusing on our ‚Äòbronze‚Äô and ‚Äòsilver‚Äô layer within our data architecture
Implementing automation features for the GDPR compliance of our data warehouse
Supporting analysts in remodeling their domain specific data in order to migrate into our new DWH structure (Medallion Architecture), if needed
Consulting our internal data producers in non-breaking data changes and modeling
Coaching less experienced colleagues (i.e. analysts) across our data stack and strongly contributing to our department-wide data governance initiatives



WHAT WILL YOU NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL?


Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS) and orchestration tools
Proficiency in building and scaling, monitoring, and maintaining data pipelines
Strong communication with stakeholders with different levels of coding / data experience
Mid-level knowledge in SQL and dbt, experienced working with relational databases and solid programming skills in Python
Experience with modern data modeling concepts and data warehousing architecture
Knowledge of data management fundamentals and data storage principles



TOOLS WE USE?


Infrastructure provisioning: Terraform
Ingestion and orchestration: Fivetran, Airbyte, Dagster
Real-time tracking: Snowplow
Transformation/modeling: dbt
Data quality: Synq
Data warehouse: Snowflake
Reporting: Looker / LookML



YOU ARE THE WORLD


We value your participation in Tourlane's success and complement your cash compensation with a package of employee stock options (ESOP).
Flexible working setup to get the most of your working hours: we offer full flexibility in our Hybrid/Remote model, however we do expect that you take advantage of our lively Berlin office 2-3 days per week
We share your passion for traveling: enjoy working abroad through our new program
Your wellbeing matters to us: we offer mindfulness classes to take care of your mental health through sessions with Nilo.health
We support all the diverse communities that make us Tourlane: join or create your own Employee Resource Group (ERG) and connect with Tourlaneans
Dog-friendly office: we can‚Äôt wait to meet your furry friend!
